sen.j: 源 義仲（みなもと の よしなか）は、平安時代末期の信濃源氏の武将。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka was a warlord of Shinano Genji clan in the late Heian Period.
MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka was a warlord of Shinano Genji clan in the late Heian Period.
MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka was a warlord of Shinano Genji clan in the late Heian Period.

sen.j: 通称・木曾次郎。
sen.e: He went by Jiro KISO.
His popular name was Jiro KISO.

sen.j: 木曾 義仲の名でも知られる。
sen.e: He was also known as Yoshinaka KISO.

sen.j: 「朝日将軍（旭将軍）」と呼ばれた。
sen.e: He was called "Asahi Shogun".
He was called "Asahi Shogun".
He was called "Asahi Shogun".

sen.j: 清和源氏の一族で、河内源氏の流れを汲む。
sen.e: He was from the Seiwa Genji clan, which was descended from the Kawachi Genji clan.
He was from the Seiwa Genji clan and a descendant of the Kawachi Genji clan.
He was from the Seiwa Genji clan and a descendant of the Kawachi Genji clan.

sen.j: 父は源義賢。
sen.e: His father was MINAMOTO no Yoshikata.
His father was MINAMOTO no Yoshikata.
His father was MINAMOTO no Yoshikata.

sen.j: 源頼朝・源義経とは従兄弟にあたる。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yoritomo and MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune were his cousins.
MINAMOTO no Yoritomo and MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune were his cousins.
MINAMOTO no Yoritomo and MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune were his cousins.

sen.j: 幼名は駒王丸。
sen.e: His childhood name was Komaomaru.
His childhood name was Komaomaru.
His childhood name was Komaomaru.

sen.j: 以仁王の令旨によって挙兵、都から逃れたその遺児を北陸宮として擁護し、倶利伽羅峠の戦いで平家の大軍を破って上洛する。
sen.e: By Prince Mochihito's order, he raised an army, supported his bereaved son, who ran away from the capital, as Prince Hokuriku, and went to Kyoto after defeating a vast force of the Heike clan at the Battle of Kurikara-toge.

By Prince Mochihito's order he raised an army, named [Mochihito's] bereaved son Prince Hokuriku who ran away from the capital and supported him; he reached Kyoto after defeating a vast force of the Heike clan at the Battle of Kurikara-toge.

By Prince Mochihito's order he raised an army, named [Mochihito's] bereaved son Prince Hokuriku who ran away from the capital and supported him; he reached Kyoto after defeating a vast force of the Heike clan at the Battle of Kurikara-toge.

sen.j: 長年の飢饉と平家の狼藉によって荒廃した都の治安回復を期待されたが、治安回復の失敗と大軍が都に居座ったことによる食糧事情の悪化、皇位継承への介入などにより後白河法皇と不和となる。
sen.e: Although he was expected to restore order in the capital, which had been devastated by the long years of famine and violence of the Heike clan, he got into bad terms with Monk-Emperor Go-Shirakawa, due to the failure of restoration of order, worsening food situation with the vast army staying in the capital, and his intervention in the imperial succession.

Although he was expected to restore order in the capital that had been devastated by the long years of famine and Heike clan's violence he came to be on bad terms with Monk-Emperor Go-Shirakawa because of his failure to restore order, worsening food situation caused by the vast army staying in the capital and his intervention in the succession of the Imperial Throne.

Although he was expected to restore order in the capital that had been devastated by the long years of famine and Heike clan's violence he came to be on bad terms with Monk-Emperor Go-Shirakawa because of his failure to restore order, worsening food situation caused by the vast army staying in the capital and his intervention in the succession of the Imperial Throne.

sen.j: 法住寺合戦に及んで法皇と後鳥羽天皇を幽閉して征夷大将軍となり（近年では征東大将軍説が有力）、その10日後に源頼朝が送った源義経の軍勢によって近江国粟津で討たれた。
sen.e: At the time of Siege of Hojujidono Temple, he incarcerated the Monk-Emperor and Emperor Go-Toba and became Seii Taishogun (it is widely believed to be Seito Taishogun recently), and was defeated by the troops of MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune sent by MINAMOTO no Yoritomo at Awazu in Omi Province 10 days later.

At the Siege of Hojujidono Temple he incarcerated the Monk-Emperor and Emperor Go-Toba and became Seii Taishogun (currently, it is widely believed to be Seito Taishogun), but 10 days later he was defeated at Awazu in Omi Province by the troops of MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune sent by MINAMOTO no Yoritomo.
sen.cmt: 法住寺合戦 (ほうじゅうじかっせん) とは、1183年に義仲が後白河法皇の院御所である法住寺殿 (ほうじゅうじどの。寺である） に火をかけて、法皇と後鳥羽天皇を幽閉した事件を指す。英語では "Siege of Hojujidono"とされていることが多いが、仕様指示書に従ってTempleを添えた。法住寺殿の部分にはハイフンはない方がよいと判断した。http://www.city.kyoto.jp/somu/rekishi/fm/ishibumi/html/hi009.htmlhttp://www5f.biglobe.ne.jp/~mind/vision/history001/kamakura001.htmlhttp://www.newworldencyclopedia.org/entry/Genpei_war
sen.e: At the Siege of Hojujidono Temple he incarcerated the Monk-Emperor and Emperor Go-Toba and became Seii Taishogun (currently, it is widely believed to be Seito Taishogun), but 10 days later he was defeated at Awazu in Omi Province by the troops of MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune sent by MINAMOTO no Yoritomo.

sen.j: 祖父の源為義と伯父の源義朝が対立的関係になった時、父為義の命を受けて本拠地の京都から関東に下った源義賢の次男として武蔵国の大蔵館（現在の埼玉県比企郡嵐山町）に生まれる。
sen.e: When his grandfather MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi and his uncle MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo got opposed to each other, he was born in Okura Yakata mansion in Musashi Province (present Ranzan-machi, Hiki-gun, Saitama Prefecture) as the second son of MINAMOTO no Yoshikata, who went to Kanto from Kyoto, the family's base, by his father Tameyoshi's order.

When his grandfather MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi and his uncle MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo were each other's enemies, MINAMOTO no Yoshikata received an order from his father, Tameyoshi, to go to Kanto from his family's base in Kyoto; Yoshinaka was born in Okura Yakata mansion in Musashi Province (present-day Ranzan-machi, Hiki-gun, Saitama Prefecture) as the second son of Yoshitaka.
sen.cmt: 嵐山町はらんざんまちと読む。以下のホームページ参照http://www.town.ranzan.saitama.jp/; sentence rearranged.
sen.e: When his grandfather MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi and his uncle MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo were each other's enemies, MINAMOTO no Yoshikata received an order from his father, Tameyoshi, to go to Kanto from his family's base in Kyoto; Yoshinaka was born in Okura Yakata mansion in Musashi Province (present-day Ranzan-machi, Hiki-gun, Saitama Prefecture) as the second son of Yoshitaka.

sen.j: 関東での源為義派の父義賢と、伯父の義朝の対立の過程で、父の義賢が甥の源義平に討たれた後、幼少の義仲は 畠山重能、斎藤実盛らの援助で信濃国（長野県）に逃れ、木曾谷の豪族、中原兼遠の庇護下に育ち、通称を「木曾次郎」と名乗る。
sen.e: In the process of the conflict between his father Yoshikata, supporting MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi in Kanto, and his uncle Yoshitomo, young Yoshinaka evacuated to Shinano Province (Nagano Prefecture) with the help of Shigeyoshi HATAKEYAMA and Sanemori SAITO after Yoshikata was defeated by his nephew MINAMOTO no Yoshihira, and grew up under the wing of Kaneto NAKAHARA, the powerful clan in Kisodani, and went by "Jiro KISO".

During the conflict between his uncle Yoshitomo and his father Yoshikata in Kanto who sided with MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi, Yoshitaka was defeated by his nephew Yoshihira; with the help of Shigeyoshi HATAKEYAMA and Sanemori SAITO young Yoshinaka evacuated to Shinano Province (Nagano Prefecture) after his father's defeat, grew up under the wing of Kaneto NAKAHARA, the powerful clan in Kisodani, and went by his popular name of "Jiro KISO".
sen.cmt: 中原兼遠は｢なかはらのかねとお」とふりがながつけられていることがある; sentence rearranged.
sen.e: During the conflict between his uncle Yoshitomo and his father Yoshikata in Kanto who sided with MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi, Yoshitaka was defeated by his nephew Yoshihira; with the help of Shigeyoshi HATAKEYAMA and Sanemori SAITO young Yoshinaka evacuated to Shinano Province (Nagano Prefecture) after his father's defeat, grew up under the wing of Kaneto NAKAHARA, the powerful clan in Kisodani, and went by his popular name of "Jiro KISO."

tit.e: Raising an Army and Going to Kyoto

sen.j: 治承4年（1180年）、平清盛と対立していた後白河天皇の皇子である以仁王（高倉宮・三条宮）が全国に令旨を発し、叔父源行家が全国で挙兵を呼びかける。
sen.e: In 1180, Prince Mochihito (Prince Takakura, Prince Sanjo), a son of Emperor Go-Shirakawa who was against TAIRA no Kiyomori, issued an order nationwide, and Yoshinaka's uncle MINAMOTO no Yukiie urged to raise armies across the nation.
sen.cmt: 後白河天皇の後白河の表記をGoshirakawaからGo-Shirakawaに統一。令旨はRyoji、prince's order を単なる orderに変更。
sen.e: In 1180, Prince Mochihito (Prince Takakura, Prince Sanjo), a son of Emperor Go-Shirakawa who was against TAIRA no Kiyomori, issued an order nationwide, and Yoshinaka's uncle MINAMOTO no Yukiie urged to raise armies across the nation.

In 1180, Prince Mochihito (Prince Takakura, Prince Sanjo), a son of Emperor Go-Shirakawa who was against TAIRA no Kiyomori, issued an order nationwide, and Yoshinaka's uncle MINAMOTO no Yukiie urged to raise armies across the nation.

sen.j: 摂津源氏の源頼政が養子にしていた義仲の兄の八条蔵人源仲家は、5月の以仁王挙兵に参戦し、頼政と共に宇治で討死している。
sen.e: Yoshinaka's older brother MINAMOTO no Nakaie, in the position of Hachijo Kurodo, who was adopted by MINAMOTO no Yorimasa of the Settsu Genji clan, joined the army of Prince Mochihito in May, and died in Uji together with Yorimasa.

Yoshinaka's older brother MINAMOTO no Nakaie was adopted by MINAMOTO no Yorimasa of the Settsu Genji clan and held the position of Hachijo Kurodo; he joined the army of Prince Mochihito in May and died in Uji together with Yorimasa.
sen.cmt: 八条蔵人とは、八条院という荘園の蔵人という役職であり、八条院蔵人と書かれている資料もあるhttp://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%85%AB%E6%9D%A1%E9%99%A2%E9%A0%98; sentence rearranged.
sen.e: Yoshinaka's older brother MINAMOTO no Nakaie was adopted by MINAMOTO no Yorimasa of the Settsu Genji clan and held the position of Hachijo Kurodo; he joined the army of Prince Mochihito in May and died in Uji together with Yorimasa.

sen.j: 同年9月7日、義仲も呼応して挙兵した（市原合戦）。
sen.e: On September 7th in the same year, Yoshinaka also raised an army in response to the order (Battle of Ichihara).
On September 7th of the same year, Yoshinaka also raised an army in response to the order (Battle of Ichihara).
On September 7th of the same year, Yoshinaka also raised an army in response to the order (Battle of Ichihara).

sen.j: 翌年の治承5年（1181年）6月、越後国から攻め込んできた城助職を信濃川横田河原の戦いで破り、一時上野国（群馬県）へ進むが、関東地方で挙兵した源頼朝とは合流せずに北陸道に進んだ。
sen.e: Next June in 1181, he defeated Sukemoto JO who invaded from Echigo Province at the Battle at Yokotagawara and advanced to Kozuke Province (Gunma Prefecture) at one point, but proceeded to Hokuriku-do without joining MINAMOTO no Yoritomo who raised an army in Kanto area.
sen.cmt: 信濃川横田河原の戦いをBattle at the Yokotagawara bank of Shinano-gawa RiverからBattle at Yokotagawaraに変更。
sen.e: In June of the following year, 1181, he defeated Sukemoto JO who invaded from Echigo Province at the Battle at Yokotagawara; he advanced to Kozuke Province (Gunma Prefecture) at one point, but proceeded to Hokuriku-do without joining MINAMOTO no Yoritomo who raised an army in Kanto area.
sen.cmt: ｢信濃川横田河原の戦い」は単に｢横田河原の戦い」と書かれていることが多く、英語では"Battle at Yokotagawara"という表現をよく見かける
sen.e: In June of the following year, 1181, he defeated Sukemoto JO who invaded from Echigo Province at the Battle at Yokotagawara; he advanced to Kozuke Province (Gunma Prefecture) at one point, but proceeded to Hokuriku-do without joining MINAMOTO no Yoritomo who raised an army in Kanto area.

sen.j: 寿永元年、北陸では逃れてきた以仁王の子を北陸宮として擁護し、以仁王挙兵を継承する立場を明示し、京の重要な食料供給源である北陸を勢力圏として固めた。
sen.e: In 1182, he supported the son of Prince Mochihito who evacuated to Hokuriku as Prince Hokuriku, declared his stance to succeed Prince Mochihito's army, and took control of Hokuriku, which was an important food source for the capital.

Prince Mochihito's son evacuated to Hokuriku, and supporting him as Prince Hokuriku [Yoshinaka] declared his continued support of Prince Mochihito's army in 1182 and took control of Hokuriku, which was an important food source for the capital.
sen.cmt: Sentence modified; it is not exactly a direct translation but I think the sentence is easier to understand this way.
sen.e: Prince Mochihito's son evacuated to Hokuriku, and supporting him as Prince Hokuriku [Yoshinaka] declared his continued support of Prince Mochihito's army in 1182 and took control of Hokuriku, which was an important food source for the capital.

sen.j: 寿永2年（1183年）2月、頼朝と敵対し敗れた源義広 (志田三郎先生)と、頼朝から追い払われた源行家が義仲を頼って身を寄せ、この2人を庇護した事で頼朝と義仲は衝突寸前となる。
sen.e: In February 1183, MINAMOTO no Yoshihiro (Saburo Senjo SHIDA) who fought against and was defeated by Yoritomo, and MINAMOTO no Yukiie who was ousted by Yoritomo relied on Yoshinaka and stayed with him, and Yoshinaka's protection of these two made Yoritomo and Yoshinaka almost fight.

In February 1183, MINAMOTO no Yoshihiro (Saburo Senjo SHIDA), who fought against and was defeated by Yoritomo, and MINAMOTO no Yukiie, who was ousted by Yoritomo, came to Yoshinaka for protection; because of this Yoritomo and Yoshinaka almost had a clash.
sen.cmt: Latter part of the sentence reworded.
sen.e: In February 1183, MINAMOTO no Yoshihiro (Saburo Senjo SHIDA), who fought against and was defeated by Yoritomo, and MINAMOTO no Yukiie, who was ousted by Yoritomo, came to Yoshinaka for protection; because of this Yoritomo and Yoshinaka almost had a clash.

sen.j: 義広と行家は両名とも義仲の叔父であり、義仲の兄が仕えたあき子内親王に縁があった。
sen.e: Both Yoshihiro and Yukiie were Yoshinaka's uncles and associated with Princess Akiko whom Yoshinaka's older brother served.
Both Yoshihiro and Yukiie were Yoshinaka's uncles and associated with Princess Akiko whom Yoshinaka's older brother served.

sen.j: 『平家物語』『源平盛衰記』では武田信光が娘を義仲の嫡男源義高 (清水冠者)に嫁がせようとして断られた腹いせに、義仲が平氏と手を結んで頼朝を討とうとしていると讒言したとしている。
sen.e: In "Tale of the Heike" and "Genpei Josuiki", Nobumitsu TAKEDA tried to marry off his daughter to Yoshinaka's heir MINAMOTO no Yoshitaka (Shimizu no Kanja), and by way of revenge for being rejected, he made a false charge that Yoshinaka was trying to defeat Yoritomo allying the Heishi clan.

In " Tale of the Heike" and "Genpei Josuiki", Nobumitsu TAKEDA tried to marry off his daughter to Yoshinaka's heir MINAMOTO no Yoshitaka (Shimizu no Kanja), and in revenge for being rejected he made a false accusation that Yoshinaka was trying to defeat Yoritomo by siding with the Heishi clan.
sen.cmt: 源平盛衰記には読み方が二通りある清水冠者もしみずのかんじゃ、しみずのかじゃと読み方が二通りある; sentence reworded.
sen.e: In " Tale of the Heike" and "Genpei Josuiki" Nobumitsu TAKEDA tried to marry off his daughter to Yoshinaka's heir MINAMOTO no Yoshitaka (Shimizu no Kanja), and in revenge for being rejected he made a false accusation that Yoshinaka was trying to defeat Yoritomo by siding with the Heishi clan.

sen.j: 3月に嫡子源義高 (清水冠者)を人質として鎌倉に送る事で両者の対立は一応の了解がつく。
sen.e: In March, by sending the heir Yoshitaka to Kamakura (Shimizu no Kanja) as a hostage, the conflict between both parties was somehow composed.
In March, the conflict between the two sides was temporarily settled by sending his heir Yoshitaka to Kamakura (Shimizu no Kanja) as a hostage.
In March, the conflict between the two sides was temporarily settled by sending his heir Yoshitaka to Kamakura (Shimizu no Kanja) as a hostage.

sen.j: 5月、越中国砺波山の倶利伽羅峠の戦い（富山県小矢部市-石川県河北郡津幡町）で10万とも言われる平維盛率いる平氏の大軍を破り、勝ちに乗った義仲軍は沿道の武士たちを糾合し、怒濤の勢いで京都を目指して進軍する。
sen.e: Defeating a vast force of the Heishi clan led by TAIRA no Koremori which was estimated to be a hundred thousand soldiers at Battle of Kurikara-toge at Mt. Tonami in Ecchu Province (from Oyabe City, Toyama Prefecture to Tsubata-machi, Kahoku-gun, Ishikawa Prefecture), the Yoshinaka's army was encouraged at its victory, rallied warriors along the route, and advanced toward Kyoto in full flood.

At Battle of Kurikara-toge at Mt. Tonami in Ecchu Province (from Oyabe City, Toyama Prefecture to Tsubata-machi, Kahoku-gun, Ishikawa Prefecture) Yoshinaka's army defeated a vast force of the Heishi clan, estimated to be a hundred thousand soldiers, led by TAIRA no Koremori; encouraged by this victory Yoshinaka's army rallied warriors en route and advanced toward Kyoto in full force.

At Battle of Kurikara-toge at Mt. Tonami in Ecchu Province (from Oyabe City, Toyama Prefecture to Tsubata-machi, Kahoku-gun, Ishikawa Prefecture) Yoshinaka's army defeated a vast force of the Heishi clan, estimated to be a hundred thousand soldiers, led by TAIRA no Koremori; encouraged by this victory Yoshinaka's army rallied warriors en route and advanced toward Kyoto in full force.

sen.j: 7月22日に義仲が比叡山に入ったという噂が広まり、25日に平氏は安徳天皇を擁して都を落ち、西国へ逃れた。
sen.e: The rumor that Yoshinaka came to Mt. Hiei spread on July 22nd, and the Heishi clan exiled from the capital with Emperor Antoku on 25th and fled to the West.
The rumor that Yoshinaka reached Mt. Hiei spread on July 22nd; the Heishi clan left the capital on the 25th with Emperor Antoku under their protection and fled to the West.
The rumor that Yoshinaka reached Mt. Hiei spread on July 22nd; the Heishi clan left the capital on the 25th with Emperor Antoku under their protection and fled to the West.

sen.j: 後白河法皇は西国へ伴おうとする平氏から身を隠し、比叡山に登った。
sen.e: Monk-Emperor Go-Shirakawa went to Mt. Hiei, hiding from the Heishi clan who tried to take him to the West.
Monk-Emperor Go-Shirakawa went to Mt. Hiei, hiding from the Heishi clan who tried to take him with them to the West.

sen.j: 7月27日、後白河法皇は義仲の軍勢に属する山本義経の子、錦部冠者義高に守護されて都に戻る。
sen.e: On July 27th, Monk-Emperor Go-Shirakawa went back to the capital, guarded by Yoshitaka, Nishikibe no Kanja, a son of Yoshitsune YAMAMOTO who belonged to Yoshinaka's army.
On July 27th, Monk-Emperor Go-Shirakawa returned to the capital guarded by Yoshitaka of Nishikibe no Kanja, a son of Yoshitsune YAMAMOTO who belonged to Yoshinaka's army.

sen.j: 『平家物語』では、「この20余年見られなかった源氏の白旗が、今日はじめて都に入る」とその感慨を書いている。
sen.e: In "Tale of the Heike", he described his emotion as "The white flag of the Genji clan enters the capital today for the first time in more than two decades".

sen.j: 義仲は翌日28日に入京、行家と共に後白河法皇の御所に参上し、平氏追討を命じられる。
sen.e: Yoshinaka entered the capital on 28th, the following day, and went to see Monk-Emperor Go-Shirakawa at his palace together with Yukiie and was ordered to search and destroy the Heishi clan.
Yoshinaka entered the capital on the 28th, the following day, and went to see Monk-Emperor Go-Shirakawa at his palace together with Yukiie; they were ordered to search and destroy the Heishi clan.

sen.j: 2人は相並んで前後せず、序列を争っていた。
sen.e: These two stood on a par with each other and struggled for ranking.
These two were on a par and competed with each other for their ranks.

sen.j: 法皇は勲功の第一を頼朝、第二が義仲、第三が行家として、あくまで義仲を頼朝の代官と位置づけ、頼朝に上洛を促す使者を送って義仲を牽制した。
sen.e: Regarding Yoritomo as the first distinguished service, Yoshinaka as the second, and Yukiie as the third, the Monk-Emperor consistently positioned Yoshinaka as the deputy administrator of Yoritomo, and restrained Yoshinaka by sending a messenger for Yoritomo to come to Kyoto.

The Monk-Emperor considered that Yoritomo had the highest degree of distinguished service, Yoshinaka the second and Yoshiie the third; he consistently positioned Yoshinaka secondary to Yoritomo and he suppressed Yoshinaka by sending a messenger to persuade Yoritomo to come to Kyoto.

The Monk-Emperor considered that Yoritomo had the highest degree of distinguished service, Yoshinaka the second and Yoshiie the third; he consistently positioned Yoshinaka secondary to Yoritomo and he suppressed Yoshinaka by sending a messenger to persuade Yoritomo to come to Kyoto.

sen.j: 8月6日には平家一門の60余名が官職から追放され、11日に後白河法皇より義仲は従五位下左馬頭・越後国守、行家は従五位下備後国守に任ぜられる。
sen.e: On August 6th, more than 60 members of the Heike clan were expelled from government posts, and Monk-Emperor Go-Shirakawa appointed Yoshinaka as Samanokami and Echigo Kokushu ranked Ju Goi-ge, and Yukiie as Bingo Kokushu ranked Ju Goi-ge on 11th.

On August 6th, more than 60 members of the Heike clan were expelled from government posts, and on the 11th, Monk-Emperor Go-Shirakawa appointed Yoshinaka as Samanokami and Echigo Kokushu with a rank of Ju Goi-ge, and Yukiie as Bingo Kokushu with a rank of Ju Goi-ge.

On August 6th, more than 60 members of the Heike clan were expelled from government posts, and on the 11th, Monk-Emperor Go-Shirakawa appointed Yoshinaka as Samanokami and Echigo Kokushu with a rank of Ju Goi-ge, and Yukiie as Bingo Kokushu with a rank of Ju Goi-ge.

sen.j: 『平家物語』ではここで義仲が朝日の将軍という称号を得て、義仲と行家が任国を嫌ったので義仲が源氏総領家にゆかりのある伊予国守に、行家が備前国守に移されたとしているが、義仲と差があるとして不満を示したのは行家のみで、義仲が忌諱した記録は見られない（『玉葉』8月11日条）。
sen.e: In "Tale of the Heike", it is said that Yoshinaka won a title as Asahi no Shogun then, and since Yoshinaka and Yukiie did not like their assigned places, Yoshinaka was transferred to Iyo Kokushu, related with Genji head family, and Yukiie was transferred to Bizen Kokushu, but actually it was only Yukiie who showed his dissatisfaction at the difference from Yoshinaka, and there is no record that Yoshinaka hated it ("Gyokuyo" Entry of August 11).

In "Tale of the Heike", it is said that Yoshinaka won the title of Asahi no Shogun then, and since Yoshinaka and Yukiie did not like the fact they shared their assigned territory with each other Yoshinaka was transferred to Iyo Kokushu, land related with Genji head family, and Yukiie was transferred to Bizen Kokushu; however, it was only Yukiie who showed his dissatisfaction at the difference between him and Yoshinaka, and there is no record of Yoshinaka's dissatisfaction ("Gyokuyo" Entry of August 11).

In "Tale of the Heike" it is said that Yoshinaka won the title of Asahi no Shogun then, and since Yoshinaka and Yukiie did not like the fact they shared their assigned territory with each other Yoshinaka was transferred to Iyo Kokushu, land related with Genji head family, and Yukiie was transferred to Bizen Kokushu; however, it was only Yukiie who showed his dissatisfaction at the difference between him and Yoshinaka, and there is no record of Yoshinaka's dissatisfaction ("Gyokuyo" Entry of August 11).

sen.j: 8月14日、義仲は新帝即位に介入し、今度の大功は自らが推戴してきた北陸宮の力であるとして、この宮を天皇として即位させるよう朝廷に執拗に申し立てた。
sen.e: On August 14th, Yoshinaka intervened enthronement of the new emperor, by claiming that this great achievement was done by Prince Hokuriku whom he backed up, and asking the Imperial Court to enthrone the Prince as the emperor with insistence.

On August 14th, Yoshinaka intervened on the enthronement of the new emperor by claiming that this great achievement was due to Prince Hokuriku whom he backed up; he insisted the Imperial Court to enthrone the Prince as the emperor.

On August 14th, Yoshinaka intervened on the enthronement of the new emperor by claiming that this great achievement was due to Prince Hokuriku whom he backed up; he insisted the Imperial Court to enthrone the Prince as the emperor.

sen.j: しかし一介の武士に過ぎない義仲の意見が受け入れられるはずもなく、朝廷では義仲を制するため御占が数度行なわれた結果、8月20日に高倉天皇の皇子で安徳天皇の弟四之宮（後鳥羽天皇）を即位させた。
sen.e: However, an opinion of a mere warrior like Yoshinaka could not be accepted, and as a result of a few divinations to restrain Yoshinaka, the Imperial Court enthroned Shinomiya (Emperor Go-Toba), a son of Emperor Takakura and a brother of Emperor Antoku.

However, an opinion of a mere warrior like Yoshinaka could not be accepted, and in order to restrain Yoshinaka a few divinatory readings were performed; as a result the Imperial Court enthroned Shinomiya (Emperor Go-Toba), a son of Emperor Takakura and a brother of Emperor Antoku.

However, an opinion of a mere warrior like Yoshinaka could not be accepted, and in order to restrain Yoshinaka a few divinatory readings were performed; as a result the Imperial Court enthroned Shinomiya (Emperor Go-Toba), a son of Emperor Takakura and a brother of Emperor Antoku.

sen.j: このあたりから伝統や格式を重んじる後白河法皇や貴族社会は知識や教養がまるでない義仲を「粗野な人物」として厭うようになっていった。
sen.e: Since around that time, Monk-Emperor Go-Shirakawa and the aristocracy, valuing tradition and formality, got to regard Yoshinaka who had no knowledge and education as "a barbarian" and disfavored him.
Since around that time, Monk-Emperor Go-Shirakawa and the aristocracy who valued tradition and formality began to dislike Yoshinaka, regarding him as a "barbarian" who had no knowledge and education.
Since around that time, Monk-Emperor Go-Shirakawa and the aristocracy who valued tradition and formality began to dislike Yoshinaka, regarding him as a "barbarian" who had no knowledge and education.

sen.j: 山村に育った義仲は、平家一門や子供時代を京都で過ごした頼朝とは違い、そうしたものに触れる機会が存在しなかったのである。
sen.e: Having grown up in a mountain village, Yoshinaka had no chance to encounter those things, different from the Heike clan or Yoritomo who had spent his childhood in Kyoto.
Unlike the Heike clan or Yoritomo who had spent his childhood in Kyoto Yoshinaka grew up in a mountain village and had no chance to encounter those things.
Unlike the Heike clan or Yoritomo who had spent his childhood in Kyoto Yoshinaka grew up in a mountain village and had no chance to encounter those things.

sen.j: また義仲は京都の治安回復にも失敗したとも言われる。
sen.e: It is also said that Yoshinaka failed to restore order in Kyoto.
It is also said that Yoshinaka failed to restore order in Kyoto.
It is also said that Yoshinaka failed to restore order in Kyoto.

sen.j: 連年の飢饉で食糧事情が極端に悪化していた京都に、遠征で疲れ切った武士達の大軍が居座ったために遠征軍による都や周辺での略奪行為が横行する。
sen.e: Since a vast army of warriors who were worn out by expedition stayed in Kyoto, where the food situation was extremely worsening by years of famine, depredation by expeditionary force was widespread in and near the capital.

Since a vast army of warriors worn out by the military expedition stayed in Kyoto where food was extremely in short supply due to years of famine, depredations by the expeditionary force were widespread in and around the capital.

Since a vast army of warriors worn out by the military expedition stayed in Kyoto where food was extremely in short supply due to years of famine, depredations by the expeditionary force were widespread in and around the capital.

sen.j: 義仲は上洛してすぐに、主立った武士達に都を守護する配置を決めて警備に当たらせたが、元々義仲の軍勢は諸国で蜂起した武士たちの寄り合い所帯であり、その中で義仲がもっとも有力だっただけで全体の統制が出来る状態になかった。
sen.e: Although Yoshinaka had major warriors guard the capital, deciding allocation to protect, as soon as he went to Kyoto, he could not control the entire army, since Yoshinaka's army was originally a patchwork of warriors who rose in revolt in different places, and Yoshinaka was just the most powerful in them.

Although Yoshinaka assigned major warriors to various positions to guard the capital as soon as he arrived in Kyoto he could not control the entire army; this was because Yoshinaka happened to be the most powerful one among his army which was just a patchwork of warriors who rose in revolt in various places.

Although Yoshinaka assigned major warriors to various positions to guard the capital as soon as he arrived in Kyoto he could not control the entire army; this was because Yoshinaka happened to be the most powerful one among his army which was just a patchwork of warriors who rose in revolt in various places.

sen.j: 後白河法皇は京都から厄介払いすることを目的として、たびたび義仲に西国へ逃れた平氏の追討を命じるようになった。
sen.e: Monk-Emperor Go-Shirakawa often ordered Yoshinaka to search and destroy the Heishi clan who had fled to the West in order to get rid of him from Kyoto.
Monk-Emperor Go-Shirakawa often ordered Yoshinaka to search and destroy the Heishi clan who had fled to the West in order to get rid of him from Kyoto.
Monk-Emperor Go-Shirakawa often ordered Yoshinaka to search and destroy the Heishi clan who had fled to the West in order to get rid of him from Kyoto.

sen.j: 法皇は自ら義仲に刀を下賜して出陣を促し、やむなく義仲は腹心の樋口兼光を京都に残して後白河法皇を牽制しながら、9月20日に平氏追討のために播磨国へ向かって出陣した。
sen.e: The Monk-Emperor urged Yoshinaka to go into battle by giving him a sword personally, so Yoshinaka had no choice but to set off to Harima Province to search and destroy the Heishi clan on September 20th, leaving his right hand Kanemitsu HIGUCHI in Kyoto for restraining Monk-Emperor Go-Shirakawa.

The Monk-Emperor urged Yoshinaka to mobilize his army by giving him a sword personally so that Yoshinaka could not disobey; he left his right hand-man Kanemitsu HIGUCHI in Kyoto in order to keep an eye on Monk-Emperor Go-Shirakawa and set off to Harima Province on September 20th in order to search and destroy the Heishi clan.

The Monk-Emperor urged Yoshinaka to mobilize his army by giving him a sword personally so that Yoshinaka could not disobey; he left his right hand-man Kanemitsu HIGUCHI in Kyoto in order to keep an eye on Monk-Emperor Go-Shirakawa and set off to Harima Province on September 20th in order to search and destroy the Heishi clan.

sen.j: 法皇襲撃
sen.e: Attacking the Monk-Emperor

sen.j: しかし海戦に不慣れな木曾源氏軍は、備中国の水島の戦い（岡山県倉敷市）で平氏水軍に惨敗。
sen.e: However, the Kiso Genji army was not used to naval battles, and was utterly defeated by the Heishi Suigun Navy at the Battle of Mizushima in Bicchu Province (Kurashiki City, Okayama Prefecture).

However, because the Kiso Genji army was not used to naval battles and it suffered an utter defeat by the Heishi Suigun Navy at the Battle of Mizushima in Bicchu Province (Kurashiki City, Okayama Prefecture).

However, because the Kiso Genji army was not used to naval battles and it suffered an utter defeat by the Heishi Suigun Navy at the Battle of Mizushima in Bicchu Province (Kurashiki City, Okayama Prefecture).

sen.j: 義仲軍は閏10月15日に京都へ逃げ帰ってきた。
sen.e: Yoshinaka's army fled and went back to Kyoto on intercalary October 15th.
Yoshinaka's army fled and went back to Kyoto on intercalary October 15th.
Yoshinaka's army fled and went back to Kyoto on intercalary October 15th.

sen.j: 義仲の出陣中に朝廷ではしきりと頼朝の上洛を促し、頼朝はこれを断って東日本からの年貢を都まで送るかわりに、東国の支配権を認めさせており（寿永二年十月宣旨）、義仲は都に戻ってからこれに抗議している。
sen.e: While Yoshinaka was in the battle, the Imperial Court continually urged Yoritomo to come to Kyoto, but Yoritomo rejected this and had his reins of the East allowed in return for sending land taxes from eastern Japan to the capital (Emperor's order in October 1183), which Yoshinaka protested after he went back to the capital.

While Yoshinaka was away fighting the battle, the Imperial Court continually urged Yoritomo to come to Kyoto, but Yoritomo rejected the invitation; Yoritomo got the Imperial Court to agree to the recognition of his reign over Eastern Japan in exchange of paying annual land taxes [to the Imperial Court] from Eastern Japan (Emperor's order in October 1183); Yoshinaka protested to this when he came back to the capital.

While Yoshinaka was away fighting the battle, the Imperial Court continually urged Yoritomo to come to Kyoto, but Yoritomo rejected the invitation; Yoritomo got the Imperial Court to agree to the recognition of his reign over Eastern Japan in exchange of paying annual land taxes [to the Imperial Court] from Eastern Japan (Emperor's order in October 1183); Yoshinaka protested to this when he came back to the capital.

sen.j: 頼朝の脅威を恐れる義仲は、頼朝追討の院宣を得ようとしたり、平氏が勢力を盛り返したのを受けて法皇を伴って北国行きを計るも拒否される。
sen.e: Yoshinaka, afraid of the menace of Yoritomo, tried to get the Monk-Emperor's decree to search and destroy Yoritomo, or tried to go to the North with the Monk-Emperor in response to the Heishi clan's regaining strength, but all was rejected.
sen.cmt: 院宣はInzen、retired emperor's decreeでなくMonk-Emperor's decreeとしました。
sen.e: Yoshinaka, afraid of Yoritomo's menace, tried to get the Monk-Emperor's decree to search and destroy Yoritomo and also tried to go to the North with the Monk-Emperor in response to the Heishi clan's regaining strength, but all requests were rejected.

Yoshinaka, afraid of Yoritomo's menace, tried to get the Monk-Emperor's decree to search and destroy Yoritomo and also tried to go to the North with the Monk-Emperor in response to the Heishi clan's regaining strength, but all requests were rejected.

sen.j: 義仲と不和となった行家は11月8日播磨国へ平氏追討に向かってたちまち敗れたのち、都に戻らず姿をくらませた。
sen.e: Yukiie, who got into bad terms with Yoshinaka, went to Harima Province on November 8th to search and destroy the Heishi clan, and he did not go back to the capital and hid himself after immediate defeat.

Yukiie, who was on bad terms with Yoshinaka, went to Harima Province on November 8th to search and destroy the Heishi clan, but after his immediate defeat he went into hiding and did not return to the capital.

Yukiie, who was on bad terms with Yoshinaka, went to Harima Province on November 8th to search and destroy the Heishi clan, but after his immediate defeat he went into hiding and did not return to the capital.

sen.j: 法皇にはもはや義仲を受け入れるつもりはなく、義仲に対抗すべく比叡山や園城寺の協力をとりつけて僧兵や石投の浮浪民などを集め、堀や柵をめぐらせ法住寺の武装化を計る。
sen.e: The Monk-Emperor had no intension to accept Yoshinaka anymore, and gathered monk warriors and Ishinage landlopers by getting cooperation from Mt. Hiei and Onjo-ji Temple to counter Yoshinaka, and had them build trenches and barriers around to arm Hoju-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 僧兵のMonkを小文字のmonkにしました。石投は裏づけとれていません。
sen.e: The Monk-Emperor no longer had the intention to accept Yoshinaka, and in order to counter Yoshinaka he gathered monk warriors and Ishinage homeless wanderers by getting cooperation from Mt. Hiei and Onjo-ji Temple and had them build trenches and barriers to arm Hoju-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: Sentence slightly modified; the word Ishinage (?) is left untouched.
sen.e: The Monk-Emperor no longer had the intention to accept Yoshinaka, and in order to counter Yoshinaka he gathered monk warriors and Ishinage homeless wanderers by getting cooperation from Mt. Hiei and Onjo-ji Temple and had them build trenches and barriers to arm Hoju-ji Temple.

sen.j: 義仲陣営の近江源氏や摂津源氏など法皇方に付く者も出てきて、数の上では義仲側を凌いだ。
sen.e: Some people including the Omi Genji clan and the Settsu Genji clan belonging to Yoshinaka's camp started to take sides with the Monk-Emperor, and his camp surpassed Yoshinaka's camp in number.

sen.j: 九条兼実は義仲を挑発する法皇の行為を「義仲たちまちに国家を危うくし奉る理なし。
sen.e: Kanezane KUJO consistently criticized the Monk-Emperor's conduct to provoke Yoshinaka as below; "There is no way that Yoshinaka will immediately jeopardize the nation.
sen.cmt: この後に出てくる｢終始批判している」をここで訳出しました。

sen.j: 唯君城を構へ兵を集め、衆の心驚かさるる条、専ら至愚の政なり。
sen.e: It is just a foolish policy that the Monk-Emperor arms the castle, rallies warriors, and upsets the public.

sen.j: 11月7日、法皇は義仲に再度平氏追討令を出して、京都から出て行くよう命じたが、頼朝の動きを警戒する義仲が承伏できるものではなかった。
sen.e: Though the Monk-Emperor issued an order for search-and-destroy of the Heishi clan to Yoshinaka on November 7th and ordered him to leave Kyoto, Yoshinaka, watching out for Yoritomo's movement, could not accept this.

sen.j: 義仲は「君（法皇）に立ち向かう心はありません」と神妙に対応した。
sen.e: "I have no intention to stand against the Monk-Emperor", Yoshinaka conducted himself properly.

sen.j: しかし11月17日、法皇は改めて義仲に京都退去を要求し、応じない場合は「追討の院宣」を下すと通告。
sen.e: However, again on November 17th, the Monk-Emperor demanded Yoshinaka leave Kyoto, and warned him that a "search-and-destroy decree" would be issued in case that he was unwilling to accept.

sen.j: 18日には後鳥羽天皇が法住寺殿へ行幸、公卿らも参内して義仲追討の院宣が下されようとしていた。
sen.e: On 18th, Emperor Go-Toba visited Hojujidono Temple and so did the nobles, and the decree for searching and destroying Yoshinaka was about to be issued.
On the 18th, Emperor Go-Toba visited Hojujidono Temple; the nobles were also gathered and the decree for searching and destroying Yoshinaka was about to be issued.

sen.j: 19日、ついに爆発した義仲は法住寺殿を襲撃して火を放ち、法皇の徴兵に積極的に関与した天台座主の明雲や後白河法皇の皇子である円恵法親王など百余人を殺害、裸形の女房らが逃げまどう中、法皇と後鳥羽天皇を五条東洞院の摂政邸に幽閉して勝ち鬨の声をあげ、政権を掌握した。
sen.e: On 19th, Yoshinaka, finally boiling over, attacked Hojujidono Temple and set on fire, and killed more than a hundred people including Myoun, the Tendaizasu, and Monk-Prince Enkei, a son of Monk-Emperor Go-Shirakawa, who were actively involved in the Monk-Emperor's induction, then while naked court ladies were running away, he incarcerated the Monk-Emperor and Emperor Go-Toba in the Sessho's house in Gojo Higashi no Toin, and raised a cry of triumph for capturing power.
sen.cmt: 円恵法親王はPrince Enkei (priest)からMonk-Prince Enkeiにしました。
sen.e: On the 19th, Yoshinaka, finally boiling over, attacked and set fire on Hojujidono Temple and killed more than a hundred people including the Tendaizasu Myoun and Monk-Prince Enkei, a son of Monk-Emperor Go-Shirakawa, who were actively involved in the Monk-Emperor's induction; while naked court ladies were running away he incarcerated the Monk-Emperor and Emperor Go-Toba in the Sessho's house in Gojo Higashi no Toin and raised a cry of triumph for capturing power.
sen.cmt: 天台座主は用語リストにTendaizazuという訳語が掲載されているが、｢てんだいざす」という読み方を多数見かけたので、その表記も記載した。法親王の訳は通常通り"Prince"とした後、括弧書きでpriestを添えているものをよく見かける; sentence slightly modified.
sen.e: On the 19th, Yoshinaka, finally boiling over, attacked and set fire on Hojujidono Temple and killed more than a hundred people including the Tendaizasu Myoun and Monk-Prince Enkei, a son of Monk-Emperor Go-Shirakawa, who were actively involved in the Monk-Emperor's induction; while naked court ladies were running away he incarcerated the Monk-Emperor and Emperor Go-Toba in the Sessho's house in Gojo Higashi no Toin and raised a cry of triumph for capturing power.

sen.j: 義仲は天台宗の最高の地位にある僧の明雲の首を「そんな者が何だ」と川に投げ捨てたという（『愚管抄』）。
sen.e: It is said that Yoshinaka threw away the head of Myoun, the monk in the highest rank in Tendai Shu, to the river, saying "Who cares such a man?". ("Gukansho")
It is said that Yoshinaka tossed the head of Myoun, the monk of the highest rank in Tendai Shu, into the river, saying "Who cares about such a man?". ("Gukansho")

sen.j: 『平家物語』で義仲が藤原基房（前関白）の娘藤原伊子を強引に自分の妻にしたという部分は史料にはみられないが、義仲が11月21日、22日に基房と深く接触している事から、ありえた事と思われる。
sen.e: Though the description that Yoshinaka forcibly married FUJIWARA no Ishi, a daughter of FUJIWARA no Motofusa (former Kampaku), in "Tale of the Heike" is not found in historical data, it could be possible because Yoshinaka made a deep contact with Motofusa on November 21st and 22nd.
sen.cmt: 関白はKanpakuでなく、Kampakuとしました。

sen.j: 11月28日には法皇に与した公卿44人を解官。
sen.e: On November 28th, he dismissed 44 nobles who took sides with the Monk-Emperor.

sen.j: 12月1日、院の御厩となり、さらに12月22日、基房の子でわずか12歳の松殿師家を内大臣摂政に任命させる。
sen.e: On December 1st, he became Mimaya betto for the Monk-Emperor, and on December 22nd, he had Moroie MATSUDONO, a son of Motofusa and only 12 years old, appointed as Naidaijin Sessho.

sen.e: On December 15th, he forced the Monk-Emperor to issue a decree for searching and destroying Yoritomo in Kamakura.

sen.j: 寿永3年（1184年）1月6日、鎌倉の軍勢が墨俣町を越えて美濃国へ入ったという噂を聞いて、義仲は大いに畏怖する。
sen.e: On January 6th, 1184, Yoshinaka had a great deal of fear, hearing a rumor that the troops of Kamakura got across Sunomata-cho and entered Mino Province.

sen.j: 1月10日には自らを征夷大将軍に任命させた（後世の編纂史料『吾妻鏡』『百錬抄』による。

sen.e: In "Gyokuyo" and "Sankai Koryo Nukigakiyo" [an extract from "Sankaiki"], journals of the same period, it is mentioned that he was appointed as Seii Taishogun on January 15th, which is more widely accepted recently).

sen.j: 播磨国の平氏との和睦工作を続け、法皇を伴って北国や近江への下向を計るが断念。
sen.e: He kept making a peace overture with the Heishi clan in Harima Province and tried to go to the North or Omi with the Monk-Emperor only to give up.
He kept making a peace overture with the Heishi clan in Harima Province and tried to bring the Monk-Emperor with him to the North and Omi, but he gave up on this idea.

sen.j: まもなく源範頼、源義経率いる鎌倉源氏軍が到着。
sen.e: Soon Kamakura Genji army led by MINAMOTO no Noriyori and MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune arrived.
Soon Kamakura Genji army led by MINAMOTO no Noriyori and MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune arrived.

sen.j: 義仲は京都の防備を固めて鎌倉源氏軍との開戦に及んだが、法皇幽閉にはじまる一連の暴挙のため、木曾源氏軍の兵士は次々と敵前逃亡し、宇治川や瀬田での戦いに惨敗した。
sen.e: Although Yoshinaka faced outbreak of the war against Kamakura Genji army, fortifying Kyoto, he was utterly defeated at battles at Uji-gawa River and Seta, since warriors of Kiso Genji army deserted in the face of the enemy one after another, due to a sequence of the outrages beginning from incarceration of the Monk-Emperor.
sen.cmt: 宇治川は一度Uji Riverにしていたのを、Uji-gawa Riverに戻しました。
sen.e: Yoshinaka fortified his defense in Kyoto and readied himself to fight at the outbreak of the war against Kamakura GENJI army; however, because of a string of reckless violence since the incarceration of the Monk-Emperor, the KISO Genji army ran away one by one from the face of the enemy, and Yoshinaka was defeated in the battles at Uji-gawa River and Seta.

Yoshinaka fortified his defense in Kyoto and readied himself to fight at the outbreak of the war against Kamakura GENJI army; however, because of a string of reckless violence since the incarceration of the Monk-Emperor, the KISO Genji army ran away one by one from the face of the enemy, and Yoshinaka was defeated in the battles at Uji-gawa River and Seta.

sen.j: 義仲自身も1月20日、近江国粟津（滋賀県大津市）で討ち死にした（宇治川の戦い）。
sen.e: Yoshinaka himself also died in battle at Awazu in Omi Province (Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture) on January 20th (Battle of Uji-gawa River).

sen.j: 「義仲天下ヲ執シ後60日ヲ経タリ」（『玉葉』）享年31。
sen.e: "It was 60 days after Yoshinaka came into power" ("Gyokuyo") at the age of 31.

sen.j: 義仲が戦死したとき嫡子・源義高 (清水冠者)は頼朝の娘大姫の婿として鎌倉にいたが、逃亡を図って討たれ、義仲の家系は絶えた。
sen.e: When Yoshinaka died in war, his heir MINAMOTO no Yoshitaka (Shimizu no Kanja) was in Kamakura as the husband of Ohime, a daughter of Yoritomo, and tried to escape only to be killed, which made Yoshinaka's family line fail.

When Yoshinaka died in the battle his heir MINAMOTO no Yoshitaka (Shimizu no Kanja) was in Kamakura as the husband of Yoritomo's daughter Ohime; he tried to escape but was killed, which put an end to the Yoshinaka family.

When Yoshinaka died in the battle his heir MINAMOTO no Yoshitaka (Shimizu no Kanja) was in Kamakura as the husband of Yoritomo's daughter Ohime; he tried to escape but was killed, which put an end to the Yoshinaka family.

sen.j: 義仲の妹である宮菊姫は北条政子の猶子となって京都にいたが、元暦2年（1185年）5月1日、彼女の名を借りた領地横領の問題に関して頼朝から鎌倉に呼び出されている。
sen.e: Miyagikuhime, Yoshinaka's sister, was in Kyoto, adopted by Masako HOJO, and on May 1st, 1185, she was summoned to Kamakura by Yoritomo, concerning misappropriation of a territory using her name.

Yoshinaka's younger sister, Miyagikuhime, was in Kyoto as an adopted daughter of Masako HOJO; on May 1st, 1185, she was summoned to Kamakura by Yoritomo concerning the issue of misappropriation of a territory that used her name.

sen.j: 政子が特に同情していたという。
sen.e: It is said that Masako especially sent her sympathies.
It is said that Masako especially sympathized with her.

sen.j: 宮菊は横領に関わりない事を弁明し、憐れんだ頼朝から美濃国の領地を与えられ、義仲恩顧の信濃国の御家人たちに宮菊を尊重するよう命が出されている（『吾妻鏡』）。
sen.e: Miyagiku explained that she was not involved in the misappropriation, then Yoritomo, feeling sorry for her, gave her a territory in Mino Province, and ordered the Gokenin in Shinano Province, whom Yoshinaka favored, to respect Miyagiku ("Azuma Kagami").

Miyagiku explained that she was not involved in the misappropriation; Yoritomo, pitying her, gave her a territory in Mino Province and ordered some of Yoshinaka's favorite Gokenin in Shinano Province to treat Miyagiku with respect ("Azuma Kagami").

sen.cmt: 獅子頭をShishi Gashira、Lion HeadからLion Maskに変更。
sen.e: A Lion Mask inscribed with the year 1598 has been handed down, which shows that it had started around that time.
A Lion Mask inscribed with the year 1598 has been handed down, which shows that it had started around that time.

sen.j: 「岩手県立博物館平成16年度伝統芸能鑑賞会/岩手県文化財愛護協会第57回岩手郷土芸能祭」に詳しい。
sen.e: Its details can be found in "Iwate Prefectural Museum 2004 Traditional Performing Arts Concert/Iwate Prefecture Cultural Property Association the 57th Iwate Local Performing Arts Festival".
sen.cmt: Wikipediaの記載に従い、英訳しました。
